Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Hougang Stadium" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(November 2020)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Hougang Stadium** is a [multi-purpose stadium](/wiki/Multi-purpose_stadium) located at the junction of Hougang Avenue 2 and Hougang Avenue 10 in [Hougang](/wiki/Hougang), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It is the main home ground of [Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League) side, [Hougang United](/wiki/Hougang_United_FC), and used mostly for [football](/wiki/Football_(soccer)) matches. The public can use the facilities from 4:30 am to 9:30 pm daily unless it is exclusively booked for a sporting event. The stadium has a capacity of 3,800 people. It can also be used for [Rugby](/wiki/Rugby_union) matches and bowling competitions. ## History - From 1998 to 2003, it was home to the Marine Castle FC - For the 2005 [S.League](/wiki/S.League) season, Paya Lebar Punggol FC played their home games at the stadium. - From 2006 to 2011, it was home to the newly merged club, Sengkang Punggol FC a.k.a. Hougang United. - From 2012 to 2023, the rebranded Hougang United Football Club will play their home games here. - From 2012 to present, this stadium is used for [Rugby](/wiki/Rugby_union) ## International fixtures DateCompetitionTeamScoreTeam6 September 2014[Friendly](/wiki/Friendly_(football)) [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team)2–1 [Papua New Guinea](/wiki/Papua_New_Guinea_national_soccer_team)9 September 2014 [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team)0–0 [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong_national_football_team) This article about a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) sports venue is a stub.
